Become a PRO PARTNER My Account Ask an expert: (303) 800-5659 Mon-Fri 9am-5pm Sat 10am-4pm Home About Us About Us Contact Us Replacement Parts Embers Fireplaces & Outdoor Living is a retail company based in Denver Metro area. We operate with our brand
                            new retail showroom in Westminster, Colorado as well as a strong online presence stocking products
                            nationwide. Our mission here at Embers is to provide and educate consumers on products that are specifically
                            designed to enhance your lifestyle. While at the same time creating a fully immersive and educational online
                            shopping experience with products that are used and sold by Embers personally. We are a family business and
                            with that in mind, we would like you to learn a little bit more about our staff. Trevor Andruss | Owner/Operator Embers was founded by Trevor in 2011, when he and his family moved to the central coast of California.
                                What started as an E-Commerce stove company, has grown into a brick and mortar retail location and a
                                full indoor/outdoor lifestyle store, offering much much more. Trevor has spent the last 11 years in the
                                hearth industry and 10 years of sales experience. He is supported by his wife, Chelsea. The Team Tayte Andruss | Colorado Showroom Manager Tayte has worked for Embers since 2015 and enjoys managing the showroom in Westminster, Colorado. His
                                    extensive knowledge of the industry and excellent people skills makes him great to work with for any
                                    of your fireplace or grilling needs. He is supported by his wife, Olivia. Tiana Robinson | Controller of Admin Services Tiana is originally from Colorado but now lives in San Luis Obispo, California. She handles
                                    everything from accounting and sales to processing our website orders. She is supported by her
                                    husband, Ian. Chad Tatum | E-Commerce Manager Chad lives in Atascadero, California. He has been with Embers for years as a salesman and manages
                                    the e-commerce side of Embers, along with some web development. He is supported by his wife, Carlee
                                    and son Ace. Beau Parrott | Head of Customer Relations Beau currently lives in Northwest Arkansas. He started with Embers back in 2013 and helped open the
                                    original showroom in California. After taking a short break, he is now back with Embers and
                                    currently handles all our technical and customer support on the online side, along with freight
                                    claims. He is supported by his wife Kristy, and their two daughters. Danielle Kelley | Colorado Showroom Sales Danielle is a Colorado native and graduated from Metro State University of Denver in 2014. She
                                    started her event management and sales career at the Denver Center for the Performing Arts and
                                    joined the Embers team in 2019. Her detail-oriented personality translates into Embers events and
                                    marketing efforts. She is supported by her husband, Evan. Randy Haines | Colorado Showroom Sales Randy has lived in Colorado for over 30 years. He is very familiar with the hearth industry and is a
                                    NFI certified hearth design specialist. Tony Roberts | Outside Sales Manager Tony has called Colorado home for over 20 years. Originally from St. Louis, MO, Tony brings a professional & unique skillset to the sales team centered around a passion for outdoor living, cooking and interior design. He is supported by his wife Sara, and their daughters Gianna & Claire. Jessie Willey | E-Commerce Development Jessie joined the team in 2019 and handles the website and marketplace development. She lives in
                                    Atascadero, California and loves the beautiful outdoors there on the Central Coast. Jessie is
                                    supported by her husband Ryan and son Brooks. Zain Quinones | Online Sales Zain is born and raised in Colorado. He joined Ember’s team in 2019. He now lives in Alaska and
                                    exceeds in helping customers find their perfect product! He is supported by his wife, Chance. Rachelle Albrecht | Office Administrator Our awesome Office Administrator is from Ann Arbor Michigan, supported by her husband Scott. Braeden Walsh | Sales Braeden joined the team in 2021, he grew up in Massachusetts and is now working sales in CO. Mary Fiske | Embers Golf E-Commerce Development Assistant Mary lives in Evansville, WI with her husband, Ryan and two children Reed and Raya. Kaitlin Prince | Receptionist Kaitlin grew up in San Antonio, TX but just moved to Colorado with the best pup from the Florida Keys. Julia Hertzner | E-Commerce Development Assistant Julia lives in Monroe, WI with her husband Logan and 2 children Braxton and Beckett. She joined the E-Commerce Development team in 2024. Close × ! CareerSource Florida Career Services Skip to content Collaborate. Innovate. Lead. Facebook page opens in new window X page opens in new window Instagram page opens in new window YouTube page opens in new window Linkedin page opens in new window CareerSource Florida Guiding workforce development for Florida Career Services Find Your Local Team Business Services Recruit and Hire Business Grants Hope Florida Master Credentials List Boardroom REACH Act Implementation Florida Credentials Review Committee Workforce Analytics About Us Our Team Reports and Publications Policies and Initiatives Contracting Opportunities Work for us Public Records News Contact Search: Career Services Find Your Local Team Business Services Recruit and Hire Business Grants Hope Florida Master Credentials List Boardroom REACH Act Implementation Florida Credentials Review Committee Workforce Analytics About Us Our Team Reports and Publications Policies and Initiatives Contracting Opportunities Work for us Public Records News Contact Turn “One Day” Into Today Career Services Take the next step on your career path. CareerSource Florida helps Floridians find careers in every industry. Whether you’re looking for a job, making a strategic career move, or building your own business, CareerSource Florida can help you reach your goal at no cost to you. Our local career centers are here, and we’ve enhanced our ability to support you online, on the phone and by appointment as available. JOB SEARCH Explore opportunities based on location, wage, industry, and education. TRAINING & EDUCATION Upgrade your skills and training to stand out from the competition. WORKSHOPS Learn career advancement tips from our employment specialists. CAREER FAIRS Directly contact multiple employers who have specific and immediate needs. Find Your Local Team CareerSource Florida is the state’s strategic policy workforce development board. CareerSource Florida does not offer direct services to individuals. However, the local workforce development boards throughout the state offer support to both job seekers and employers. These local one-stop or career centers offer services like tailored career counseling, skills assessments, resume assistance, and job placement support. Our local centers are here to assist you with improved support, available online, over the phone, and in-person by appointment when available. Search Location In Radius: Km Loading... Number Of Locations : 0 PRINT × Store Direction GET DIRECTIONS × From: To: Km Miles GET DIRECTIONS Use my location to find the closest Service Provider near me × USE LOCATION Description × Reemployment Assistance CareerSource Florida is committed to helping Floridians find meaningful employment opportunities; however, Reemployment Assistance benefits are administered by the Florida Department of Commerce. To apply for benefits, check eligibility, or view frequently asked questions, click on links below. FAQS APPLY Train For Your Next Job Learning new skills is a great way to start your career or move up at your current job. Career and Technical Education (CTE) and apprenticeship programs can further your education and help you earn higher wages. These programs teach you skills you will use on the job from Day One and throughout your career. If you are interested in earning an industry-recognized credential, we can connect you with training and education opportunities near you. Explore programs offered by CareerSource Florida and our partners, including the Florida Department of Education. CTE FAQS APPRENTICESHIP CareerSource Florida Mailing Address: 2308 Killearn Center Blvd, Ste 101 Tallahassee, FL 32309 info@careersourceflorida.com Find Your Local Team QRT Grant IWT Grant Boardroom News Policies and Initiatives Reports and Publications Contracting Opportunties Contact Analytics NEWS RECAP: CareerSource Florida Board of Directors Advances Policy Modernization, Credentialing, and Workforce Readiness at August Meetings RECAP: CareerSource Florida Board of Directors Drives Statewide Workforce Progress with Strategic Investments and Policy Direction CareerSource Florida Hosts Inaugural Workforce Day at the Capitol CareerSource Florida is an equal opportunity employer/program. Auxiliary aids and services are available upon request to individuals with disabilities. All voice telephone numbers on this website may be reached by persons using TTY/TDD equipment via the Florida Relay Service at 711. This website is supported by the Employment and Training Administration of the U.S. Department of Labor and U.S. Department of Health and Human Services as part of awards totaling $34 million with 0% financed from non-governmental sources. ® 2025 CareerSource Florida Go to Top

A Symphony of Smoke and Flavor: Unveiling Embers Wood Grill HOME BOOK NOW ALL SHORT-TERM RENTALS LARGE GROUPS NEAR UF CAMPUS PRIVATE POOLS COMMUNITY POOLS DOWNTOWN GAINESVILLE BUDGET NEAR UF SHANDS HOSPITAL ACCESSIBLE HOMES PET-FRIENDLY MEDICAL HOUSING CORPORATE HOUSING CONSTRUCTION CREWS TRAVEL NURSE HOUSING AIRBNB PROPERTY MANAGEMENT THINGS TO DO THINGS TO DO IN GAINESVILLE THE STAYGAINESVILLE EXPERIENCE ABOUT US ABOUT US CONTACT BLOG RESOURCES FOR REALTORS GATOR ATHLETES RELOCATION GUIDE FAQs PRIVACY POLICIES WEBSITE TERMS & CONDITIONS BEST OF THE BEST TERMS & CONDITIONS Book Now Get in touch (352) 519-3994 info@staygainesville.com HOME BOOK NOW ALL SHORT-TERM RENTALS LARGE GROUPS NEAR UF CAMPUS PRIVATE POOLS COMMUNITY POOLS DOWNTOWN GAINESVILLE BUDGET NEAR UF SHANDS HOSPITAL ACCESSIBLE HOMES PET-FRIENDLY MEDICAL HOUSING CORPORATE HOUSING CONSTRUCTION CREWS TRAVEL NURSE HOUSING AIRBNB PROPERTY MANAGEMENT THINGS TO DO THINGS TO DO IN GAINESVILLE THE STAYGAINESVILLE EXPERIENCE ABOUT US ABOUT US CONTACT BLOG RESOURCES FOR REALTORS GATOR ATHLETES RELOCATION GUIDE FAQs PRIVACY POLICIES WEBSITE TERMS & CONDITIONS BEST OF THE BEST TERMS & CONDITIONS A Symphony of Smoke and Flavor: Unveiling Embers Wood Grill A Symphony of Smoke and Flavor: Unveiling Embers Wood Grill in Gainesville, FL Website: https://embersofflorida.com/ Address: 3545 SW 34th Street, Suite A, Gainesville, FL 32601 The StayGainesville Connection: StayGainesville's Susannah Peddie met June Allen, one of the owners, through The Junior League of Gainesville in 2003. They were "roommates" at a Junior League conference and realized that her husband's cousin was Susannah's aunt. Charles, June's husband, and I have joked for years and called each other "Cuz." When they were looking for artwork for the restaurant, June contact Susannah and offered the restaurant as a gallery. Susannah had a blast finding the perfect prints for Embers and hosted 3 solo art shows in the beautiful outdoor area. Embers is a favorite of Susannah's- the pan seared sea bass and the gator tail are her personal favorites. Embers Wood Grill is a haven for those seeking a unique and flavorful dining experience.  This restaurant isn't your average grill; it's a celebration of the magic of open-fire cooking, where fresh, seasonal ingredients are transformed into culinary masterpieces through the mastery of wood smoke.  From the inviting aroma that greets you at the door to the explosion of textures and tastes on your palate, Embers Wood Grill offers an unforgettable dining experience that goes beyond the ordinary. A Passion Ignited: The Story Behind the Embers Embers Wood Grill's story began with a passion for open-fire cooking and a desire to share it with the Gainesville community.  The founders, Chef Britton Dumas, June & Charles Allen and Sommelier Ryan Todd, inspired by the time-honored techniques of grilling and smoking over wood flames, envisioned a restaurant that showcased the unique flavor profile and versatility of this cooking method.  Their commitment to quality extends beyond the open fire; they source fresh, seasonal ingredients from local farms, ensuring each dish is bursting with flavor and crafted with care. An Ambiance as Warm as the Fire: Immersing Yourself in the Embers Experience Step inside Embers Wood Grill and prepare to be enveloped by a warm and inviting atmosphere.  The open kitchen allows you to witness the culinary magic firsthand, as chefs expertly maneuver ingredients over crackling flames.  The exposed brick walls and rustic décor create a sense of casual sophistication, while the aroma of wood smoke hangs in the air, whetting your appetite for the delectable dishes to come. A Dance with Fire: Unveiling the Delights of the Embers Menu The menu at Embers Wood Grill is a testament to the versatility and power of wood-fired cooking.  Each dish is thoughtfully crafted to highlight the unique smoky flavor imparted by the open fire: Starters: Enjoy gator tail or pan seared fois gras as a delicious, mouth-watering starter. The Art of Open-Fire Cooking: The heart of Embers Wood Grill lies in their selection of wood-fired main courses. From succulent steaks and chops to perfectly cooked seafood, each dish showcases the mastery of open-fire cooking. The signature steak is a must-try, boasting a perfectly charred exterior and a juicy, flavorful interior. For seafood lovers, the wood-roasted salmon with a lemon-herb crust is a delightful option. Vegetable Delights Embraced by Flame: Vegetarians and vegans need not despair. Embers Wood Grill offers a dedicated selection of wood-fired vegetable dishes that are anything but boring. A Toast to the Good Life: The Embers Beverage Selection Embers Wood Grill understands that the perfect meal deserves the perfect drink.  Their beverage selection offers something for every palate: An Extensive Wine List: Explore a curated wine list featuring a diverse selection of reds, whites, and sparkling options. The knowledgeable staff is happy to help you find the perfect pairing for your chosen dish. Craft Beers on Tap: For those seeking a more casual option, Embers Wood Grill offers a selection of craft beers on tap, featuring local and regional breweries. Creative Cocktails: Indulge in one of Embers Wood Grill's signature cocktails, featuring unique flavor combinations and handcrafted elements. More Than Just a Meal: Embers Wood Grill as a Community Hub Embers Wood Grill goes beyond being a restaurant; it aspires to be a community hub where people can gather, connect, and celebrate over delicious food: A Perfect Spot for Special Occasions: Whether it's a romantic date night, a celebratory dinner with friends, or a special family gathering, Embers Wood Grill provides a warm and inviting atmosphere ideal for creating lasting memories.  The attentive staff ensures a seamless dining experience, allowing you to focus on enjoying the company and the delectable food. Gainesville also supports local artists. Susannah Peddie's art is featured throughout the restaurant. Beyond Embers: Exploring Gainesville's Delights Embers Wood Grill serves as a perfect starting point for exploring the vibrant city of Gainesville: A Stone's Throw from the Swamp: The restaurant is conveniently located just a short drive from Ben Hill Griffin Stadium, affectionately nicknamed "The Swamp," home to the Florida Gators football team. Enjoy a pre-game meal at Embers Wood Grill to fuel up for the game and soak in the electrifying Gator spirit. Downtown Delights: Venture out and explore the lively streets of downtown Gainesville. Stroll past charming shops, grab a coffee at a local cafe, or visit the historic Hippodrome State Theatre to catch a movie. For a dose of art and culture, explore the Harn Museum of Art or the Matheson Museum. Nature's Escape: Gainesville offers a surprising amount of natural beauty. Take a stroll through the Kanapaha Botanical Gardens, a haven for tropical plants and serene walking paths. For a more adventurous escape, kayak on the Santa Fe River or explore the diverse ecosystems of Paynes Prairie Preserve State Park. A Final Note: Embers Wood Grill – A Celebration of Flavor and Community Embers Wood Grill isn't just a restaurant; it's a celebration of the magic of open-fire cooking, fresh, local ingredients, and a warm and inviting atmosphere.  From the symphony of smoky flavors on your plate to the attentive service and vibrant ambiance, Embers Wood Grill offers an unforgettable dining experience that goes beyond the ordinary.  So, next time you find yourself in Gainesville, Florida, step inside Embers Wood Grill, embrace the warmth of the fire, and savor a delicious meal that celebrates local bounty and community spirit. Looking for a place to stay while visiting the local Gainesville attractions? Look no further than Gainesville's locally owned vacation rental company, StayGainesville . Book directly on our site, or call us at 352-519-3994 for guidance. For homes and condos, StayGainesville has many options- large and small/ budget and luxury, and more. For a shorter stay, we have 2 beautiful historic Inns in downtown Gainesville. The Camellia Rose Inn and The Laurel Oak Inn - both have unique personalities and they both feel like a home away from home. Looking for more things to do in Gainesville? Visit our Things to Do link. < Older Post Newer Post > Satchel’s Pizza: Gainesville's Most Artistic Slice By Susannah Peddie • September 10, 2025 Experience Satchel’s Pizza in Gainesville, FL — iconic pies, funky art, and the legendary van you can dine in. A must-visit blend of food, culture, and fun. Fall is here! 30 Day Calendar (of fun) for Gainesville, FL By Susannah Peddie • September 10, 2025 Discover the best events in Gainesville, High Springs, and Newberry over the next 30 days. Festivals, concerts, football, food, and family fun—plan your trip today! More Posts Gainesville, FL Find Us: Call: (352) 519-3994 Email: info@staygainesville.com We are a short-term property rental company with a deep local presence. We support the Gainesville community in so many ways. We hire locally, we use local vendors, we partner with local businesses, and we love sharing our love of Gainesville with all of our guests. Florida Everblades | Front Office Florida Everblades Tickets Single Game Tickets Blades 365 Memberships Group Fun Fan Experiences Auto-Renewal Program Premium Seating Seating Chart My Account Digital Ticketing Guide 2025-26 Schedule Team News & Info Hockey Central News Videos Roster Player Stats Standings Front Office Hockey Operations Game Day Info Hertz Arena Info Hertz #1 Club Breakaway Sports Pub Seating Chart Everblades App Parking Media/Scout Credential Request Contests Watch and Listen Community Corporate Partners DASH Auctions Partnership Opportunities Non-Profits Appearance Requests Donation Requests Recreational Rinks Fan Club Everbabes Junior Everblades Birthdays FanSaves Discounts Blades Backers Shop Schedule Get Tickets Ticket Categories Single Game Tickets Blades 365 Memberships Group Fun Fan Experiences Premium Seating Toggle Menu Schedule Tickets Single Game Tickets Blades 365 Memberships Group Fun Fan Experiences Auto-Renewal Program Premium Seating Seating Chart My Account Digital Ticketing Guide 2025-26 Schedule Team News & Info Hockey Central News Videos Roster Player Stats Standings Front Office Hockey Operations Game Day Info Hertz Arena Info Hertz #1 Club Breakaway Sports Pub Seating Chart Everblades App Parking Media/Scout Credential Request Contests Watch and Listen Community Corporate Partners DASH Auctions Partnership Opportunities Non-Profits Appearance Requests Donation Requests Recreational Rinks Fan Club Everbabes Junior Everblades Birthdays FanSaves Discounts Blades Backers Shop Home Front Office Front Office Executive Management Craig Brush Florida Everblades President & Hertz Arena CEO Craig Brush, Hertz Arena CEO and President of the Florida Everblades, along with partners Peter Karmanos and Thomas Thewes, founded the Everblades and Hertz Arena in 1998.

A native of Milton, Ontario, Brush oversees all aspects of both the hockey club and the sports complex.

The Everblades won the Kelly Cup and the ECHL Championship in 2012,2022, & 2023, captured the Brabham Cup four times, and have reigned as conference champions on four occasions.

During the 2004 and 2005 Kelly Cup Playoffs, the Everblades became the first team in ECHL history to make back-to-back trips to the Kelly Cup Finals. 

From 2003-06, Brush served as the Chairman of the ECHL Board of Governors. He was inducted into the ECHL Hall of Fame (Class of 2016) in the Builders category, on Feb. 5, 2016 in a ceremony in Kalamazoo. 

As a player, Brush played four seasons at Cornell University, where he was a member of the 1970 undefeated NCAA Championship team, which is the only team in collegiate history to accomplish this feat.

In addition, he coached in the Compuware youth hockey program for many years.

Craig and his wife, Kyle, split time between Estero, Florida and Birmingham, Michigan. The couple has three sons -- Matt, Tyler and Patrick -- as well as five grandchildren, Anna, Mary, Jane, Sloan, and Brett. Scott Bryant Hertz Arena President and Chief Financial Officer Chris Palin Executive Vice President & Chief Revenue Officer Chris serves as Executive Vice President and Chief Revenue Officer for Hertz Arena and The Florida Everblades. In this capacity, Chris is responsible for a comprehensive P&L oversight for the revenue growth, profitability, and corporate sponsorship success of the Everblades. He also is responsible for developing and executing the team’s comprehensive sales and marketing plan. Palin joined the Hertz Arena and Everblades staff in Aug. 2010 after spending 21 seasons with the Rochester Americans of the American Hockey League in the same capacity. While with the Americans, he earned the prestigious ‘McKenzie Award” after the 1997-98 season for excellence in marketing. Additionally, Chris spent 14 seasons with the Rochester Knighthawks of the National Lacrosse League, 12 seasons with the Rochester Rhinos of “A” league soccer, and 10 seasons with the Rochester Rattlers of Major League Lacrosse where he held the position of Vice President of Sales and Marketing. Palin is a graduate of the State University College at Brockport where he earned a Bachelor of Science in Business with a concentration in Sports Management. At Brockport, he was a member of the hockey team. He is the all-time leading scorer for the program and holds the record for the fastest goal to start a game. Chris and his wife, Renee, have one son, Tyler. Adam Winslow Executive Vice President & Chief Marketing Officer Adam Winslow is in his fifth season as the Executive Vice President and Chief Marketing Officer for the Florida Everblades and Hertz Arena. In this role, he oversees marketing, public relations, media relations, broadcasting, social media, and community relations for the Everblades and all events at Hertz Arena. He is also responsible for developing and executing the team’s comprehensive strategic sales and marketing plans. Winslow is integral to the team's success, contributing to the Everblades winning the Team Award of Excellence by the ECHL in 2022, 2023, and 2024. He has been recognized at the ECHL League level as an inaugural member of the Commissioner's Club which is recognition for those that meet or exceed the league's revenue standards of $1,000,000 in ticket and corporate partnerships revenue . He joined the Everblades staff in February 2020 after spending three seasons as the General Manager of the New York-Penn League's Auburn Doubledays and their facility, Leo Pinckney Field at Falcon Park. During his time with the Doubledays, Winslow managed all aspects of sales, marketing, and operations for the organization and its multi-purpose facility. His chief responsibilities included season ticket sales, group sales, corporate partnerships, stadium operations, food and beverage operations, finance, and human resources. He also served as the team's representative to the Washington Nationals (MLB) and the New York-Penn League of Minor League Baseball. Before his role with the Doubledays, Winslow spent 10 seasons with the Rochester Americans (AHL) and Rochester Knighthawks (NLL), as well as five seasons with the Rochester Rhinos (USL) and Rochester Rattlers (MLL). He received numerous promotions within ticket sales and corporate partnerships departments, ultimately serving as Vice President of Ticketing & Operations for the last three seasons with the Americans and Knighthawks. Winslow is a graduate of the State University College at Brockport, where he earned a Bachelor of Science in Physical Education with a concentration in Sports Management. While at Brockport, he was a member of the men’s NCAA Division III hockey team. Adam and his wife, Nichole, have twin boys, Morgan and Mason. Brad Ralph General Manager & Head Coach Brad Ralph was named the fifth head coach in Everblades' history on July 12, 2016. Ralph, 42, enters his eighth year as the head coach of Florida and 14th season as a professional head coach, where he has qualified for the playoffs every year. Ralph has amassed a career coaching record of 565-243-81 spread over the Southern Professional Hockey League, Western Hockey League, and ECHL. Ralph's 79 career wins in the Kelly Cup Playoffs are in first place all-time. Brad Ralph led the Florida Everblades to back-to-back Kelly Cup Champions in 2022 and 2023. In 2018-19, Ralph guided the Everblades to their fourth South Division title in five seasons, served as a head coach in the ECHL All-Star Classic for the second time in his career and advanced to the Eastern Conference Finals for the second consecutive year. In 2017-18, Florida set club records for wins (53) and points (112) while reaching the Kelly Cup Finals for the fourth time in club history. He also received the John Brophy Award as the ECHL Coach of the Year. In 2015-16, he helped lead the Kelowna Rockets of the Western Hockey League to a 48-20-4 record and a third-round appearance in the playoffs. Ralph coached the Idaho Steelheads of the ECHL for three seasons (2012-15) totaling a 132-64-20 mark along with three postseason appearances. Ralph began his coaching career with the SPHL's Augusta RiverHawks (2010-12), and led his team to the league finals in his first year to garner honors as the SPHL's Coach of the Year. As a player, Ralph appeared in 383 pro games split mainly between the ECHL and American Hockey League, while making his lone NHL appearance with the Phoenix Coyotes during the 2000-01 season. Ralph resides in Estero with his wife, Wendy, and two children. Arena Management Karl Masnjak Vice President of Recreational Facilities Danielle Higgins Vice President of Accounting & HR Collette McCormick Vice President of Food & Beverage Scott Zimmerman Senior Vice President of Event Booking Randy Klinck Assistant General Manager Paul Daniels Director of Ticketing Isaac Berg Director of Merchandising Communications and Community Relations Sam Shapiro Public Relations, Media & Communications Manager Sam Shapiro is a Miami, Florida native and a proud graduate of Florida Gulf Coast University. He joined the as an Event and Marketing Intern for Hertz Arena in 2021 and has since become an integral part of the team's marketing and promotions efforts. As he continues to grow and develop in his role with the Everblades, Sam remains committed to delivering exceptional results and helping the team achieve its goals both on and off the ice. Jake Maurice Play By Play Broadcaster / Communications Coordinator Jake Maurice is on his second season with the Florida Everblades and Hertz Arena. Prior to interning with the Everblades and arena, he spent three seasons broadcasting for the Manitoba Junior Hockey League’s Winnipeg Blues and Winnipeg Freeze. During his time in Canada, he also worked as a producer at talk radio station CJOB and provided out-of-town scoreboard updates on the Winnipeg Jets radio broadcasts. He graduated from Red River College in 2020 with a diploma in Creative Communications, specializing in Public Relations. A native of Raleigh, NC, Maurice is a fan of the Florida Panthers, Detroit Lions, and Detroit Tigers. She graduated from Florida Gulf Coast University (FGCU) in May 2024 with a Bachelor of Arts in Communication and a concentration in Public Relations. Currently, she is pursuing a Master of Business Administration at FGCU with a specialization in Digital Marketing Strategy. Lilly initially joined the organization in January 2023 as a Communication, PR, and Marketing Intern for Hertz Arena and the Florida Everblades. In her role as Marketing Coordinator, she remains dedicated to enhancing the fan experience through innovative marketing strategies. Support Staff Sports Marketing Interns: Elise Griffin, Hannah Smith, Sarah Belof Event Marketing Interns: Brooke Johnson, Karah Sherwin, Michaela Dodig Content Creation Interns: Bella Jones, Makenzy Martin Creative Services & A/V Tyler Center Director of Creative and A/V Tyler was born and raised in Southwest Florida and grew up cheering on the Everblades. He serves as the Director of Creative and A/V. In this role, he is responsible for leading all creative work in and around the arena, along with overseeing the production booth. Prior to working for the ‘Blades in this current role, Tyler gained experience by working for the Florida Panthers as a Graphic Design Intern and for the Everblades as a Production Crew Member. He graduated from Florida Gulf Coast University with a bachelor’s degree in Marketing with a minor in Management. Aside from the Everblades, Tyler is a fan of the Florida Panthers, New York Rangers, and the New York Mets. Barrett Abney A/V Technician Support Staff Team Photographer: Patrick Onufer Creative Services Interns: Brooke Benjamin, CJ Grossbard, Fletcher Baldwin, Kaeleigh Counts, Kolson Kaminski Ticket Sales and Partnerships Mike Kelly Vice President of Business Development & Broadcasting Mike Kelly is in his 11th season with the Florida Everblades and Hertz Arena. A 3-time ECHL All-Star Game Broadcaster, Kelly serves as the TV Play-by-Play Broadcaster for the Everblades, highlighted by being ‘ on the call’ for the 3-Peat Kelly Cup Championships in 20 22, '23 and '24. Kelly is also responsible for Corporate Partnerships, Season Memberships and Group Sales , where he has b een part of the “ECHL - Overall Team Award of Excellence" five times with the Everblades in '20, '22, '23, '24 and '25. He has also been recognized at the league level as the Sales Professional of the Year, Ticket Executive of the Year, PR/Media Relations Director of the Year and is a 2-time member of the Commissioner's Club in '24 and '25. His broadcasting and sales experience also includes eight years in the American Hockey League with the Springfield Falcons and Syracuse Crunch. A dual citizen of Canada and the United States, Kelly has an additional hockey broadcasting background with the ECHL Mississippi Sea Wolves and South Carolina Stingrays, plus the Toronto St. Michael’s Majors and Barrie Colts of the Ontario Hockey League. He also has experience as a Sportswriter and Producer for The Sports Network in Toronto. Mike and his wife, Suzanne, have a son, Greg. Calvin Isaac Director of Sales Calvin Isaac is in his ninth season with Hertz Arena and the Florida Everblades and his third season as the Director of Sales for the Blades. Calvin oversees the day to day operations of the Ticket Sales Department, and specializes in Corporate Sponsorship, Season Memberships, and Group Sales. Prior to joining the Everblades, he worked with multiple professional sporting organizations while pursuing his bachelor’s degree from PennWest University. His experience includes work with the Pittsburgh Penguins (NHL), Pittsburgh Pirates (MLB), and the PGA. Calvin and his wife Samia love residing in SWFL and enjoy spending time with their dog, Josie the beagle! Meagan Johnson Corporate Partnerships & Game Experience Manager Meagan Johnson is entering her tenth season with Hertz Arena and the Florida Everblades. As the Corporate Partnerships and Game Experience Manager, Meagan is responsible for the fulfillment of all 180+ advertising agreements with our corporate partners. She also oversees in the game day experience from start to finish. Meagan graduated with a bachelor's degree in Marketing from the University of North Georgia and a bachelor's degree in Sport Management with a minor in Accounting from the University of West Georgia. She graduated Cum Laude with both degrees. Meagan played collegiate softball and was apart of the 2015 DII National Championship team while at the University of North Georgia. Meagan moved to Estero from Georgia in 2016. She met her husband, James, while working at Hertz Arena. Together they share their son, Griffin. Meagan is a stepmom to Landen and Kendal. Chandler Guest Season Membership Manager Chandler Guest is in his sixth season with the Florida Everblades and Hertz Arena. Guest joined the ‘Blades after graduating in May 2019 from Florida Gulf Coast University with a bachelor's degree in Business Management with a concentration in Sports. While completing his undergraduate studies, Guest gained experience in the sports industry through positions with the Jacksonville Jumbo Shrimp, the class Double-A affiliate of the Miami Marlins, and FGCU Athletics' Ticketing Department. He worked for the Jumbo Shrimp in their inaugural season in 2017 and then worked for FGCU's Athletic Box Office for a year and a half. A native of Jacksonville, Guest is a fan of the Tampa Bay Lightning, the Atlanta Braves, and the Jacksonville Jaguars. Jake Pariseau Group Sales Manager Jake is entering his fifth season with the Florida Everblades and Hertz Arena. Jake is originally from Attleboro, Massachusetts, and received his undergraduate degree from Florida Southern College. He graduated with a Bachelor of Science degree in Sport Management with Magna Cum Laude distinction. Jake’s experience before joining our team included interning in the ticket office for Providence College in 2019 and being a Sports Assistant Intern for Polk County Tourism and Sports Marketing in 2019-2020. Being from Massachusetts, Jake is a huge and very passionate Boston sports fan, with his favorite teams being the Red Sox, Patriots, Celtics, and Bruins. Katy Risvold Event Promotions & Game Experience Associate / Account Executive Katy, a proud native of the State of Hockey, grew up in Mound, Minnesota. She has been with the Everblades for two incredible Kelly Cup Championships: in 2023 as a Game Production Intern and in 2024 as a full-time staff member. Her focus within the organization is ensuring every game is an unforgettable night for our fans. Whether overseeing promotions, enhancing fan engagement, or contributing to the sales team, she is dedicated to elevating the Everblades experience. Katy roots for the Vikings, Twins, and Golden Gophers, with her favorite sports team being the Minnesota Wild. Kailee O'Brien Account Executive Kailee O’Brien, a Columbus, Ohio native, is entering her second season as an Account Executive with the Florida Everblades. She played NCAA Division II lacrosse at Florida Institute of Technology, where she was a two-time All-American and earned both her Bachelor’s in Business Administration/Sports Management and her MBA. Kailee joined the Everblades as a Marketing Intern during their 2023 Kelly Cup championship run. Experiencing that unforgettable season firsthand inspired her to return full-time and help bring the excitement of Everblades hockey to fans. A lifelong sports fan, she especially loves lacrosse and proudly supports the Buckeyes, Blue Jackets, and Steelers. Shaheen Noorzai Account Executive Shaheen is beginning his first season as an Account Executive for the Florida Everblades. Hailing from the Washington, D.C. area, he earned his undergraduate degree from West Virginia University. During his time there, Shaheen worked for two years in the video department with the WVU football team while also collaborating with the athletic department and ESPN+. Currently, Shaheen is pursuing a graduate degree in the University of South Carolina’s renowned sports management program. He has gained valuable experience, including working at the prestigious 2024 Masters Tournament and interning in the Citadel Athletic Department in Charleston, SC, focusing on corporate partnership sales. A passionate sports fan, Shaheen supports the New England Patriots as well as the D.C.'s sports franchises in the Wizards, Capitals, and Nationals. Asked Questions Contact Us Why Passing Up on Embers Wood Grill Would be a ‘Mis-steak’ Julia Child once said, “The only time to eat diet food is while you’re waiting for the steak to cook.” Luckily for our town, even that time can be filled with eating buttery crab and lobster cake and zesty blackened shrimp and grits. Embers Wood Grill holds one of the top spots in our steakhouse book for the perfect blend of fine dining, superior service, and, most importantly, dangerously, delectable dishes. With so many prime choices on their menu, it can be hard to decide what to order. We’ll make it easy for you. Here is a list of our top choices at Embers. For a list of other recommendations in Gainesville download our Vacation Guide ! Access Your Guide to Gainesville Sesame and Pepper Crusted #1 Loin Yellowfin Tuna Since our city is between Cedar Key and St. Augustine, it’s no wonder this authentic ahi made the list. Embers Wood Grill uses the highest grade yellowfin, cut directly from the center block offering you the heartiest filet of fish possible. Top that with mango-sweet pepper slaw and a rice wine reduction and you won’t want to leave a morsel behind. We should mention that owner Ryan Todd, certified by the Court of Master Sommeliers, boasts a nine-time award-winning wine list from Wine Spectator Magazine . You’ll want to pair this yellowfin tuna dish with a savory, dry French rosé, and you’re in good hands with the selections. Flaming Crème Brulee Save room for dessert. Visit only for dessert. Eat dessert for an appetizer. It doesn’t matter how you do it, but you must order this luscious, flame-broiled treat. The vanilla custard will arrive flaming in the sweet orange aroma of Grand Marnier. The moment you crack the crispy shell on top to the moment the waiter pulls the dish from your table goes quickly. Trust us, you’ll only need one spoon. Gulf of Mexico Blue Crab Bisque Rich, hearty, and fresh. Crafted flawlessly, the cream-based bisque combines hints of tart white wine with a generous portion of blue crab and is topped off with a crusty grilled crostini. This stout bisque would make for a perfectly paired surf and turf with the prime porterhouse. Braised Beef Short Ribs Get back to basics with this meat and potato meal. The succulent, robust ribs are roasted with an entire head of garlic and basked in caramelized onions. Pair it with Ember’s delectable lobster mashed potatoes, and a Woodford Reserve Old Fashioned. Dine to the relaxing sounds of the streaming fountain on the outdoor patio, and you’ll have a night to remember. And, of Course, the 10-ounce Prime Filet Mignon Hand-cut from the center of the tenderloin, this perfectly seared and seasoned piece of meat will take your steak game from backyard grill-mate to culinary expert with the flip of a spatula. All steaks are cooked over a wood fire grill to your liking, but we recommend ordering this one rare. Cooked deliberately and at a low temperature, this prime, center-cut meat will melt in your mouth like exquisite velvet without the typical runniness of a rare-cooked steak. Pair it with the truffled mac and cheese and sautéed diver scallops. Yum. Stay at Sweetwater Branch Inn! Ready to call it a night? Just six miles from the restaurant’s front steps, Julia’s Room waits for you to fall into her cushioned, king-sized bed. Wake up and enjoy another unparalleled culinary experience at The Cushman House . Scents of cinnamon French toast casserole, peppered gravy, savory biscuits, and house-made melba sauce fill the halls of Sweetwater Branch Inn. Call today to guarantee your stay with us! ← 4 Rad Summer Camps in Gainesville (And What to Do When You Escape!)
